intro: Otholobium venustum, commonly known as the white everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its hardy nature. Otholobium venustum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
